channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: This man was abused for appearing on a Welcome to Heathrow poster. Then he met his trolls

item.title: Survey shows successful reintroduction of eastern quolls to mainland Australia
item.description: An endangered "native cat" is making a celebrated comeback, with a breeding population of eastern quolls making a new home for themselves in a small pocket of south-east mainland Australia.

item.description: Dozens of musicians have busted out their best, competing in the national busking championships in Stanthorpe, Queensland.

item.title: The moment I knew: I saw her enjoying herself in her perfect little witch’s hat and I was a goner

item.title: From Amarillo to Stockport: 15 of Neil Sedaka’s greatest songs, and their extraordinary stories

item.title: Having romped into third place in Gorton and Denton, Labour is celebrating its success with a word salad | Marina Hyde
item.description: As David Lammy put it on Thursday in a dispatch from Gorton and Denton: “Only Labour can stop Reform.” And listen, stopping them by taking third place and haemorrhaging half your support from a general election that took place 19 months ago in an area where you haven’t lost an election for almost 100 years is definitely an intriguing way to do it.

Today, the Green party have won the Gorton and Denton by-election with nearly 41% of the votes, beating Reform into second place and Labour third.
